title: Desperation Grows as Texas Flood Rescues Stretch Into Third Day
summary: Scott Ruskan, a Coast Guard swimmer, is credited with saving 165 people at the all-girls’ camp from dangerous floods. “They want some sort of comfort, someone to save them.”

title: A Family of 6 Was Swept Away in the Texas Floods. Now, Survivors Wait and Hope.
summary: A woman whose mother, stepfather, aunt, uncle and cousin are among the missing confronts the unimaginable. A cousin was dragged downriver 15 miles but survived.

title: Texas Flood Victims: What We Know
summary: A beloved teacher, child and adult campers, camp directors and a counselor are among at least 81 people who have died in the flooding in Central Texas.

title: Israel’s Deadly Assault on Iran Prison Incites Fury, Even Among Dissidents
summary: The June 23 airstrikes on Evin prison, including the hospital ward, have turned it from a hated symbol of oppression into a new rallying cry against Israel, even among the Iranian regime’s domestic critics.

title: Trump Says Musk Is ‘Off the Rails’ With America Party Effort
summary: The tech billionaire’s effort to create a new political party, called the America Party, comes amid a ramped-up feud with the president over his new domestic policy law.

title: Social Security Email Says Policy Bill Eliminates Tax on Benefits. Does It?
summary: The Social Security Administration circulated an imprecise email about the provisions in the new law. Here’s what it actually does.

title: How Europe Got Stuck Between Xi’s China and Trump’s America
summary: European Union officials will spend July in talks with China. Tensions are high, hopes are low and stability is the end game.

title: Can Taiwan Really Disconnect Its Economy From China?
summary: Momentum is building in Taiwan to lessen its business dependency on China, its biggest trading partner. Doing so will not be easy.

title: Bessent Says He Expects Trade Deals by This Week’s Deadline
summary: But the Treasury secretary also said that some countries working toward agreements with the United States could have until Aug. 1.

title: Ozzy Osbourne and Black Sabbath Play Final Shows in Birmingham, England
summary: Heavy metal fans crossed continents to converge on Birmingham, England, and throw devil horns in honor of the Prince of Darkness and Black Sabbath.

title: Nearly Half of America’s Murderers Get Away With It
summary: Most crimes go unsolved, emboldening criminals and potentially leading to more violence.

title: South African Police’s Frequent Use of Torture Echoes Apartheid’s Brutality
summary: A government led by freedom fighters who helped to liberate the country more than 30 years ago is now overseeing a police force accused of staggering abuses.

title: Erin Patterson Is Found Guilty of Murder in Australia Mushroom Poisoning Case
summary: Three people died in 2023 after eating beef Wellington made by Erin Patterson, whose subsequent trial gripped the country.

title: Keir Starmer Is Fading Away
summary: After a year in power, Keir Starmer appears to be losing not just political weight but material substance, too.

title: Times Readers Open Up About the Real Cost of Motherhood
summary: What’s the real cost of motherhood? Here’s what our readers said.

title: Tropical Depression Chantal Brings Flooding to Parts of North Carolina
summary: Chantal made landfall as a tropical storm early on Sunday. Heavy rains led to widespread flooding in central North Carolina.

title: The Coder ‘Village’ at the Heart of China’s A.I. Frenzy
summary: As China vies with Silicon Valley for primacy, Hangzhou, home to DeepSeek and Alibaba, is where its aspiring tech titans mingle and share ideas.

title: As Drones Spot Sharks, New York Beaches Are Shut Down
summary: Drone technology seemed to contribute to an unusual number of shark sightings along Rockaway Beach in recent days. Each time swimmers were ordered out of the ocean.
